intro: Gypsocallis lanata, commonly known as the woolly gypsocallis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features fleshy, tuberous roots and strap-like, often hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive, lantern-shaped structure. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers a warm, sunny environment.
